Charles has $ 5q + 1$ quarters and Richard has $ q + 5$ quarters. The difference in their money in dimes is:\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 10(q - 1) \qquad\textbf{(B)}\ \frac {2}{5}(4q - 4) \qquad\textbf{(C)}\ \frac {2}{5}(q - 1) \\
\textbf{(D)}\ \frac {5}{2}(q - 1) \qquad\textbf{(E)}\ \text{none of these}$
